go_data.justification: Akt is involved in the PI3K-AKT-mTOR pathways and the Akt-mTOR-p70S6K signaling.
Akt is mentioned to be involved in the anabolic processes mediated by Akt-mTOR-p70S6K signaling.
Activation of NF-kB can also generate muscle atrophy by opposing myogenic differentiation, and NF-kB also seems to interfere with the IGF1-Akt signaling pathway.
Akt phosphorylation is associated with the level of eIF4e, which is involved in translation initiation, and consequent impairment of protein synthesis.
Akt is part of the IGF1-Akt signaling pathway and the PI3K-AKT-mTOR pathways.
